text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that in Italy, any derivative work (a work that modifies the original work) is a violation of copyright. The candidate answer explicitly addresses this under the analysis of Shirt 1: \"This is almost certainly infringing. Under Italian copyright law, a cartoon character can be protected as a distinct artistic work when it has sufficiently distinctive features. Changing the outfit and adding sunglasses does not create a new, independent work â€” it is a modification (elaborazione) of the original under Article 4 of the Italian Copyright Law. The right to make adaptations and modifications belongs exclusively to the author under Article 18.\" This directly confirms that unauthorized modification (creating a derivative work) is a violation.", "criterion_id": "2d176723-fe0c-4a13-bed9-134e0c1a0360"}
